website_summaries.verdict: The game play and scoring are noticeably different from traditional Scrabble, but younger players will get a good verbal workout as they fill in the blanks. A child-friendly option for family game nights.
pros: Two-sided game board offers basic and advanced game play
Employs both visual and basic reading skills
Older children and adults can play the unstructured advanced version
cons: Game is very basic, matching preexisting words
Older children may lose interest quickly

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT have the original board...
customer_reviews.text: One of the reviews said this comes with the original "adult" board on the back of it. This is not the case! The board on the back is completely blank. No extra point spaces. In addition to that, the letters are all cardboard, super flimsy! And it doesn't come with a little stand to set your pieces in. If your children are reading, just buy the original Scrabble. If they're not, maybe you'd want this one or maybe you'd want to just help them... Either way, I'm returning this and buying the original. Cardboard tiles are not going to last long with children. Of all the things to cheap out on...
customer_reviews.author: DragonLady

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves this game.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my daughter for fun, and also to help her with letter/word recognition. She absolutely loves this game and we play it several times a week. The characters are cute, the colors are bright. I love that it has 2 sides, one for more of a matching game, and the other is a regular scrabble board for when they're ready to move up to level 2. I wish it had extra tiles, for back up in case the originals get lost. There are just enough to finish the level 1 side. It would also be great if it came with a bag to keep the tiles in, but otherwise, the game is great!
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mom

customer_reviews.title: For those children it was a big disappointment that there isn't any difference in the regular version ...
customer_reviews.text: For 1st graders and up that know how to spell, even short words, get the real game. For those children it was a big disappointment that there isn't any difference in the regular version and this version other than the poor awful quality.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah S.

customer_reviews.title: Fun on both levels
customer_reviews.text: Fun with letters and words, and a great way to introduce the concepts of the game of Scrabble. Five year old not interested, but I played it with 7 year old who loved it. She wanted to make her own words, and was disappointed that there aren't any blank tiles, but caught on quickly to the basic level of simply matching the words on the board. There is a little strategy but mostly just fun and luck of the draw. Now older sibling will show the younger one. Quality is lightweight, and I hope they won't lose the little tiles. It was appealing enough for older one to put down a tablet and play a board game.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great game, bad packaging.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I'm deducting a star is for packaging. Lately board games like this are designed so that the packaging is advertising, rather than practical. Once you actually take the game out, the shape and structure of the box is pretty inconvenient (note the little windows where the players sit.)
customer_reviews.author: jonesd

customer_reviews.title: Great game to begin board games
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Junior Scrabble to encourage my 6 and 7 year old grandchildren to continue to work on their phonics work. They love using the side where they cover the letters of words that exist. They're not at the point of putting together their own words, but are finding where they can substitute letters in words that exist. We count a point for every word that's completed. They're beginning to learn how to strategize so they (not I) are left to complete a word. This works in many ways!
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Great for my almost 4 year old
customer_reviews.text: Bought this gift to reward my two kids for doing so well in "homeschool" during Covid-19, and it was a hit. My almost 8 year old thought the game was too babyish, as he's on a 2nd grade reading level, but my almost 4 year old daughter thought it was fun to participate in game night with her older brother. She needed help from mom/dad, but it was good fun for the whole family. We also bought a real scrabble bored for my 1st grader, which is way more appropriate for him, but this junior version is great for kids just learning to read.
customer_reviews.author: lisa760

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cr@p
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a Scrabble game. It is some shoddy cardboard permutation of a game that uses letters but that is about all it has in common with Scrabble. I expected an inexpensive Scrabble game with larger letters to begin playing Scrabble with my grandchildren as I didn't want to use my much more expensive set. This pretty much went in the recycle and was replaced by the least pricey Scrabble set.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha A.Top Contributor: Quilting

customer_reviews.title: good learning tool, versatile
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old grandson. I like that the board has 2 sides to it. For younger kids it already has some words plotted out on the board. That side is good for teaching the concepts of scrabble without getting sidetracked with trying to think up words on their own. The other side of the board is the traditional game that adults are used to. My only real complaint is that the letter tiles are cheap cardboard. So while the concept of the children's version is great, the actual quality of the game is poor.
customer_reviews.author: sandra m bieber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for us
customer_reviews.text: Great game for our 7 & 8 year old kiddos. There is a very "guided" version of the game on one side of the board, so they can learn how it works and then a more traditional format on the other side. This would make a great gift, although we just gifted to ourselves. Everyone should do that!
customer_reviews.author: Ana F

customer_reviews.title: Confusing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at the onset of the pandemic to have a few new games in the house. This game is hard to understand, myself included. My kids lost interest immediately. I remember scrabble jr as being a fun game, this was sadly a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Good game for young kids
customer_reviews.text: We are lovers of Scrabble, so we bought this for one of our granddaughters. It's nice because there are two levels to this board game. The one side is for kids who are reading but who need help to figure out words, and the other side is for kids who are a little older and can make words on their own. She is 7 and really liked the easier side--she isn't quite ready for the harder side. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: mkmkm

customer_reviews.title: Good Game - Starter for kids and can be used for Adults too
customer_reviews.text: Good Game. Has two sides, one for kids and other for adults. Good packing. Good for gifting. It has easy points system and colorful lead characters. Easy to play for 5 years old kid. The alphabets are somehow not plastic but the paper, which is not good as kids will tear it anytime. It would be great if spellings can be changed. Like by writing or changing letters. So kid can learn more words.
customer_reviews.author: Gunjan Talsania

customer_reviews.title: A fun game for early readers...
customer_reviews.text: While the quality of the board and the pieces aren't as good as the adult version of scrabble, it still is a good buy for early readers. My kids are 4,5, and 6 and we really enjoy playing this game together. It is simple enough even for my 4 year old to participate in, and there is still the option to play on the other side of the board without the words on the board. If you are looking to get a younger kid hooked on the game that doesn't quite know how to spell well enough yet, this game is a great buy. If you are looking to play regular scrabble, just buy regular scrabble.
customer_reviews.author: Haven Kasselman

customer_reviews.title: My 7 year old was disappointed
customer_reviews.text: For 1st graders and up that know how to spell words this is a big disappointment. We bought this for our 7year old but she got easily bored by it. On top if it the scoring is manual where each alphabet is only one point unlike the original scrabble. The quality of the game is also just ok. For the younger kids of kindergarten and below this would be more suited.
customer_reviews.author: Jay K.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly popular with young players
customer_reviews.text: Was so surprised that my five year old granddaughter LOVED this game. We must have played it five times the first day. It is designed to grow with the child’s abilities, starting with words already printed so that you are only required to accumulate the letters to make those words and scaling to very similar full Scrabble play. We will get many years out of this game.
customer_reviews.author: T. Herbert

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for 3-5 yr olds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 and 5 yr old daughters. The game was easy to understand. They especially loved the cute little game pieces. It reinforces my 5 year old's reading abilities and it's a good introduction to sight words for my 3 year old. One complaint as always with board games, are the boxes it comes in. They almost always tear at the sides. Letter pieces are made of cardboard but they seem pretty durable so far.
customer_reviews.author: Femme7981

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: We took Scrabble Jr. on a vacation with a 9 and 6-year-old and us two 30-something-year-old adults. We had a lot of fun with it, the kids were able to locate the words based on the images on the board. The 6 year old got bored after awhile, but us adults still enjoyed the competition of being the winner.
customer_reviews.author: KeatsAndCorbs

customer_reviews.title: Very good learning tool, even if not keeping score!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 5 year old granddaughter and she loves it. She had played the first side with her Mom and Dad, but I convinced her we should try the second side, and she caught on very quickly! The one downside is the way the board folds in quarters, it may not last long with an independent 5 year old wanting to put it away herself!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Educational, Versatile Age-Groups
customer_reviews.text: This game was recommended by our school. This board has two sides which is great. One with words they have to match and a blank side for one they can make up their own words. My 3 year old started playing with us and can do it. He doesn't know all of the letters by name but he can match them which will help him read. A great gift for elementary school kids. We play a couple of games of this a week and our kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: MelLuvsCharlie

customer_reviews.title: Fun game and easy to play
customer_reviews.text: Fun game and easy to play. I do wish there were more letter tiles but I understand you can buy them separately? There is only one letter per letter on the board. So there is only one z in the box, one qu, and so on. Just something to beware of the first time you play.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ward

customer_reviews.title: fun game for new speller
customer_reviews.text: my daughter is learning to spell and this game helps encourage that without it feeling like WORK. Love that we can play with her and it's not boring! Game board has two sides one blank and one with words already on it. Started with the first side with words on it and it helps her learn words!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer K

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality game! My kids enjoy playing it! It is easy for the younger kids to play this since the words are already on the board. I love as they get older you can turn over the board and spell your own words. The only downfall is a wish the letters were plastic or wood. The cardboard letters were a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: luvxojenn

customer_reviews.title: good for a variety of ages
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect game to play with our twin grandsons (Kindergarten age). It has two levels: traditional scrabble and one where the letters are already on the board and you match them, a letter at a time (not waiting for the whole word). Even their 9 year old brother likes playing it. Great traditional game to play at Gramma and Poppop's house!
customer_reviews.author: QuiltLady254

customer_reviews.title: Cute games for younger kids
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 5 year old. He’s working on sight words so I thought this would be a fun way to introduce some new words and make learning fun. This is such a cute game to play with the kiddos. One side is just matching the letters to make words. The words are printed on the board so it makes it very easy for kids to match them. You can flip the board over to take things up a level by creating your own words.
customer_reviews.author: Arie

customer_reviews.title: The board has two sides so it will grow with us!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like that the pieces are just cardboard without being laminated, the first time the game was used one of the pieces tore when we were popping out the cardboard pieces from the cardboard. But that being said we love the game, me son is 6 and hates reading and writing. This he plays and doesn’t know that he is learning. The board has two sides so it will grow with us!
customer_reviews.author: Kiz

customer_reviews.title: Maybe skip the JR and get the traditional?
customer_reviews.text: We love scrabble so we thought this would be fun to play with our 7 year old. I think she may be a little too old for this. I didnt like the paper letters or the board itself really. We played it once and we’ll likely be donating it.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for beginner spellers and the other side of the board is blank, to play the regular game (but the pieces don’t have scores mentioned). It also helps kids to strategize while playing. That said, the pieces are a little flimsy and something sturdy would be great especially with kids playing.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well made, easy to understand and great for early readers and those just beginning to read. The game token guys are near unbreakable. The letters are thick cardboard with a coating so they are durable enough. Would definitely buy again to give as a gift
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Somethings wrong
customer_reviews.text: Whoever made this game didn’t think it through. The easier version For younger players (if played by the rules) would take hours to complete. We had to quit long before completing the game and my kids both age 9 are pretty good spellers. Didn’t try the harder version yet but can’t imagine how many hours that would take to complete.
customer_reviews.author: cyn_denn

customer_reviews.title: great game!
customer_reviews.text: What a great game! My six year old really wanted to join in on the Scrabble fun. She loves this version of it, which will grow with her as she learns to spell her own words. My only beef is how Scrabble cuts costs these days - the cardboard tiles were kind of a letdown, as was the lack of a bag to keep them in. A bag, at least, would be handy!
customer_reviews.author: dori

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Family Game
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 & 5 yr old & we play this game at least once a week. The words are spelled out on one side of the board to help the kiddos and once they both have the spelling down we can flip it over for a regular scrabble board. It does take a little time to get the points and finish but this will make for a GREAT family game.
customer_reviews.author: Ben & Love

customer_reviews.title: Such a cool
customer_reviews.text: This game is so cool! We can play the easy side with our 5 year old and he’s just working on matching letters. And we can play the difficult side with our 7 year old. I’m so so glad we got this junior scrabble game!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lemming782

customer_reviews.title: My 5 year old and her friends love this game.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for young kids still learning to read. It’s a bit of a learning curve. As far as point distribution goes. But all in all it’s good. Worth the money. We love family board games. Especially if it helps our 5 year old learn!
customer_reviews.author: danielleshmanielle

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids of All ages!
customer_reviews.text: I love this game! One side is pre-printed with early reader words with matching pictures (car, kitten, etc.) and each person places just two letter tiles per turn, and the person that finishes the word gets a point. The other side is a regular scrabble board. You get the best of both worlds!
customer_reviews.author: YoungGlow (Knoxville, TN)

customer_reviews.title: Awesome family fun!
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game! My oldest son had the older Scrabble Jr. and I was so excited to find a newer version. My 6yo and I have the best time playing these games. It is great for both spelling and word recognition. The triangle chips have been replaced with little men that move around the board as you complete a word. So cute!
customer_reviews.author: Total Boy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for reading or learning to read
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game to play with your kids. There is an easier side with premise words you can build your tiles on while your child is learning how to read. Then there is the more challenging board where you and your kids build your own words. I play this all the time with my 6 and 4 year old and we have had this game for 2 years now.
customer_reviews.author: D'Italia

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and good for early spellers
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my 5 year old twin nieces. I find the step one version easy to play with these beginning readers/spellers. I love the easier format - and the fact there are steps built into the game which allow for growth before bridging to the full version. I think we'll enjoy this for a couple of years so a good investment. So many games geared toward this age group are outgrown so quickly I hesitate to spend the money but I'm pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grows with child.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very age-friendly game of Scrabble. On one side you have words that are already spelled out and on the other side you have a regular Scrabble board. So, it will grow with your child.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L Bettencourt

customer_reviews.title: Scrabble for young kids
customer_reviews.text: My six year old grandson didn’t think it was fun. it seemed to be a dumbed down version of the game I played as a kid. I don’t think this offers any real gaming or learning experiences for a first-grader.
customer_reviews.author: CynDS

customer_reviews.title: A game that grows with your reader!
customer_reviews.text: Great fun way to work with younger age groups still learning to read. I love that they give you a blank side of the board to up the level by creating your own words too!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Candy

customer_reviews.title: Learning fun
customer_reviews.text: We take this game with us when our grandkids go camping with us. It really helps them with spelling and vocabulary. Playing Scrabble has always been popular in our family and this junior version is perfect for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Pankow

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great family game! Our 7 year old loves this game and it’s easy for him to play! Our entire family loves to play this game together, even the grandparents agree to play a game when this is picked. It’s easy and quick, we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our 5 and 7 yr old family game night. Kindergartener doesn't read yet, but has the side that's easy for him to locate letters. Other side is perfect for my avid speller and reader when he wants to challenge mom.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee W.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 7 year old God son. We played it for hours on Christmas Eve, when I gifted it to him, and he loved it! Took him a little while to grasp the rules (making words from existing words) but he caught on. You could really see his brain churning to create words and earn points. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Evans

customer_reviews.title: Teaches strategy
customer_reviews.text: Our 6 year old granddaughter LOVES this game and even learned how to play defensive with us on her own. And she played it when she was five also.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne L.

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: My nephews aged 7 and 10 really enjoy this game. On the one side, they can play by themselves with very little help. The game can grow with them.
customer_reviews.author: Rhea

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for children learning the basics of spelling / reading / writing. It is fun and and an enjoyable method to reinforce what learners are studying in school. It was fun to start with the basic game. When that was too easy, we graduated to the more challenging side of the gameboard.
customer_reviews.author: CDubya

customer_reviews.title: Happy with game
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this game for my granddaughter who was in Kindergarten and she loved playing it with us. She is beginning learning to spell and read and this game is perfect. there is another level to the game as she advances her skills.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help my son learn his letters. He was still too young to play when I first got it. But now he is almost 4 and LOVES Playing now. The board is big and colorful. The letters are easy to see
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Brown

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother.
customer_reviews.text: This game was a horrible knock-off of Scrabble. No fun whatsoever. I donated it after the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Karey

customer_reviews.title: Great for Letter Recognition
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game as a gift for my five year old niece. She played it for the first time with her grandmother. They both loved it. It was easy to explain to her, interactive, and more thought provoking than many of her other games where players just spin a dial and move around a board. She will get more use out of it as well because the board can be flipped over when she is ready to make her own words.
customer_reviews.author: Amber B.

customer_reviews.title: Great early reading/letter recognition
customer_reviews.text: It is a great game for beginning readers and for learning letter recognition for younger kids. It doesnt have a tray or rack to hold the tiles making it difficult for players to keep tiles hidden while still searching for game play. Thats the only reason I didnt give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Georgi

customer_reviews.title: One of my 5 year old's (now 7) favorite game!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great way to help younger kiddos get started with spelling words and recognizing their letters. It offers a more standard version of scrabble (although smaller) on the back of the board (so, 2 games in 1).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scrabble Junior Game
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness This is sooo much fun. My 5 year old granddaughter is learning to read an spell an she loved this. The one side where the words are one the board is the best learning tool. In fact she beat me when we played.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Gray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a beginning reader
customer_reviews.text: This was such a great buy for our five year old granddaughter! So far we have only played the side that has the words already printed on the board and you have to have the letters to make the word on the board. It is a great introduction for a beginning reader! I highly recommend this game.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: A definite winner!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is going to be a great gift it was well packaged and it does not look cheap and the price was better than Walmart the game is colorful and bright and really fun even for adults
customer_reviews.author: VENOMnVIPER

customer_reviews.title: Grandma isn't sure about it
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it! I think it's ok. I was hoping for more actually.....more like the adult version but for kids to understand. It's ok
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied.Need all 26 letters to create more words.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like that there was limited letters,wasn’t 26, doesn’t leave room for to many words to create. Tonya
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good learning game
customer_reviews.text: A good gift for little kids . But if the kids are older than 10 days then it would not be that great else a wonderful learning tool
customer_reviews.author: Apurva Saxena

customer_reviews.title: Amazon's fabulous customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game. The kids love it. I wanted to thank Amazon because I wrote saying that I lost a letter and wanted to purchase a replacement letter. Amazon sent me a new game for free. That's what I call fabulous customer service
customer_reviews.author: Yaely56

customer_reviews.title: my 5yr old loved it
customer_reviews.text: Sweet game! My 5 year old loved it and is a good teaching tool. Has 2 levels so you can start with beginners easily and move up to harder level later.
customer_reviews.author: KaraH

customer_reviews.title: Not your mom's scrabble!
customer_reviews.text: This is modern junior scrabble. Flashier than the one I bought y kids 30 years ago. The 8 years old I gave it to for Christmas loved it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Copland

customer_reviews.title: Great for four year old, longer game
customer_reviews.text: It takes more attention span as this game lasts approx 30 minutes but we like it quite a lot. It grows with their learning ability.
customer_reviews.author: Rider16

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the young kids
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 year old grand kids love this. They can not spell yet but you can play in "match mode" learning their letters. FUN!
customer_reviews.author: coinhound

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a kids board game I actually like to play!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 5 year old and it's a great game! I have always enjoyed playing traditional scrabble and this is a great family game for young kids. The 2 sided board will allow it to grow with your child. Any child who can match letters can play!
customer_reviews.author: AshleyJ1109

customer_reviews.title: Finding it easy to play with 4 years old but he tored ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. Finding it easy to play with 4 years old but he tored the board on the first day itself. I wish that would have been more sturdy or could be replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: Swati

customer_reviews.title: Great game for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My kids got this for Christmas this year and it was such a great gift. They both love the game! I love that there are 2 sides one with words that you fill in as you play and one that you makeup your own words. It's great for kids who are learning to read.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: My grandson really likes this game.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson really likes planning this game. He is 7 years old so the pictures really help him to understand how to play. On the other side of the board there are no pictures which will be great when he can play better.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy M.

customer_reviews.title: Would be better with letter stands like traditional Scrabble.
customer_reviews.text: Came in good shape. Wish it had letter stands like in the original game. We gave the kids our spares.
customer_reviews.author: N Shryock

customer_reviews.title: I had to return it because it says for age ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it because it says for age 10+ when I bought it, but it was actually for kids 5-8.
customer_reviews.author: Venus

customer_reviews.title: We enjoyed playing this
customer_reviews.text: Bought to play with my grandson. He's 7yrs. Old. We played with the side that had words in it already. We had a good time.
customer_reviews.author: Cbreeze475

customer_reviews.title: A great version for kids!
customer_reviews.text: The board was a bit flimsy. It would Not lay completely flat, but it doesn’t interfere with playing the game. Great for the kids! Ten year olds wanted to play several rounds.
customer_reviews.author: A. Whitt

customer_reviews.title: Great classic game.
customer_reviews.text: Love the double side for emerging readers. My son is a bit too old for the pre’filled in side, but still a fun game for kids.
customer_reviews.author: norah wakefield

customer_reviews.title: The best game!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my almost 7-year old daughter for Christmas and it’s seriously such a fun learning game. She loves it! We love playing it with her as well! It’s easy to understand and fun for everyone in the family!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca F.

customer_reviews.title: Not very exciting.
customer_reviews.text: This game is for matching letters. My 4 and 5 year old grandkids like it for now. It does not hold the interest of the 9 year old and I cannot see the two younger ones having much interest after they are better readers and build vocabulary. I would not recommend this for any kids over 6. Not a long lived toy option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grandchildren Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Our Grandchildren ages 6 and 8 love the game. It helps them develop with spelling and sound out new words. The whole family enjoyed playing Scrabble on Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: JLO

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding customer service ,great product
customer_reviews.text: Very professional and outstanding customer service, will definitely order again from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: A good game to keep the kids busy in the current scenario while learning new word skills. Recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikhil

customer_reviews.title: Good game overall, just a bit hard for little ones
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game overall, but my kids didnt seem to like it to much. Its a bit complicated for little kids to play and the kids have to have a lot of patients.
customer_reviews.author: FranS18

customer_reviews.title: Scrabble jr game
customer_reviews.text: our Granddaughter loves playing this with me. Good teaching game. Nice addition to our dvd collection.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: great family game
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4, 5 and 7 year old and we can all play this together. We have a lot of fun and the kids ask to play it.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Mom and dad play a lot of board games with our granddaughter. She really a smart 5 yr old, time and money well spent!!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Scrabble Jr
customer_reviews.text: Love to play this game with my 6 and 7 year old niece and nephew. They enjoy the game and learn at the same time. Only complaint is about packaging. The game cardboard box was damaged upon arrival. Game inside was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kseniya

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my grandson for Christmas. I received the game in plenty of time for Christmas. I remembered how much fun my kids had playing that game so I thought my grandson would as well. We have spent some fun hours playing the game together. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very fun, great learning game.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 7 year old daughter for Christmas and we both love it. It's fun for both of us, even using the 'easy' side. It requires a bit of strategy and she likes making and reading the words, so we both enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P.

customer_reviews.title: Great improved oldie
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for kids 5 and up. I love the fact that it's a two sided board allowing different levels of difficulty so your child can grow with it.

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: Such an adorable game for little ones! Highly suggest this if you are looking for a new game to play!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Learning is fun with Scrabble
customer_reviews.text: This game is perfect for prereaders teaching them to use letters to form words. The game board has pictures to help young children identify words. The game is fun to play and does teach letters and words. Hopefully, the children will go on to learn adult Scrabble.
customer_reviews.author: Victor T. Bucci

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Great game, love that it has 2 levels one side has the words for those barely learning and the other side is blank for the older kids that know how to make words.
customer_reviews.author: Nery

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as original scrabble
customer_reviews.text: Ok quality. The “tiles” are just thin cardboard-type material. My kids didn’t really care for this version of scrabble or the secondary game that could also be played using this board.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M

customer_reviews.title: Durable playing pieces!
customer_reviews.text: Durable playing pieces! Wish there were more fun ideas with it for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: TDev

customer_reviews.title: Its ok.
customer_reviews.text: The game was SHIPPED DAMAGED. Returned and replaced easy. Takes a while to play so attention span gets tested, but not bad.
customer_reviews.author: DvTm

customer_reviews.title: I love that we are able to practice letter sounds and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's birthday. I love that we are able to practice letter sounds and counting while playing a fun game. One side has words spelled out so its really about matching and trying to complete a word before your opponents. The other side of the board is blank so your own words can be spelled out. The game pieces are for keeping track of the score; each point is an advancement along the track that outlines the game board. I think we will be playing this game quite often.
customer_reviews.author: UnderTheRisingMoon

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for an educational game
customer_reviews.text: My six-year-old niece and I love playing this game. We play the side with the pictures now, but it's made to grow with her so it will last for years. Great educational game and not too boring for me to play repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: A. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Damaged game board
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter but when we opened it, the board fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: Gina R. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great game! I love that it have a double ...
customer_reviews.text: Great game! I love that it have a double sided board so that you can convert it to a normal Scrabble game. My five year old can easily play the prefilled out side of the board. My only negative is the letter tiles. They are just cardboard cutouts that are not very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Gifted.!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item was gifted to my great-nephew and hopefully he is enjoying it .
customer_reviews.author: SONNY 😉

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It is nothing like the original Scrabble. My granddaughter hated it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Primack

product_meta.title: Scrabble Junior Game
product_meta.description: What a great way for kids to play America’s favorite word game! Kid-sized words and colorful pictures make it fun to match letter tiles to words on the grid. Players move their funny tokens up the score track as they score points. When all of the tiles have been placed on the board, the player with the most points wins! Don't worry, your little ones won't outgrow this game; just turn the board over for the advanced level, where they come up with their own words. It's going to be letter-matching fun for everyone with Scrabble Junior. Scrabble and all related characters are trademarks of Hasbro.
feature_bullets: Scrabble Junior is letter-matching fun for your little one
2-sided gameboard has an advanced level on the opposite side
Players create their own words in the advanced level

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
